passage_text: If you are using the oven, put the plank on a cookie sheet or piece of foil, and heat the plank for 5 minutes in the oven. Instructions. Soak the plank in water for at least 45 minutes. You can do this in advance and freeze the plank until you're ready to use it. Spray some oil on the plank and place it in the oven while you preheat to 350F. Place salmon skin-side down on plank. Massage salmon rub into fish. Directions. 1  Preheat oven to 350 degrees. 2  Place the salmon, skin side down, on the cedar plank. 3  Cover with foil. 4  Serve with fresh lemon wedges. 5  To grill: Follow instructions above, except put the plank with salmon (covered with foil) directly on the grill. Directions. 1  Preheat oven to 350 degrees. 2  Place pre-soaked cedar plank on a rimmed baking sheet. 3  Place the salmon, skin side down, on the cedar plank. 4  In a small bowl, combine the sugar, oil, thyme, and cayenne. 5  Spread over the salmon.

Preparation. Baking Directions: Preheat cedar plank at 350 degrees for about 10-15 minutes. Brush salmon with olive oil or butter, season it with salt and place it on the on the plank. If using an oven, cook at 450 degrees until done. Baste with the glaze twice during the last five minutes of cooking. If you are using a grill, use the indirect cooking method.
